Copying and Printing from Visual Diff

With Visual Diff, you can copy text to the clipboard or print the files you are comparing.

To copy text:

  1. In a pane of the Visual Diff window, drag the cursor from the first to the last character of the text you wish to select.

  2. Select Edit > Copy from the menu or click the Copy button to copy the selected text to the clipboard.

To print the file comparison:

  1. In the Visual Diff window, compare two files.

  2. Select File > Print from the menu or click the Print button on the toolbar. The Print dialog opens. (If you wish to select a different printer, see the procedure immediately below, which describes how to change the printer setup.)

  3. Specify the pages you wish to print, and enter any other information required for your printer.

  4. Click OK. The files are printed as a single file – that is, in the "shown together" view.

To change the printer setup:

  1. From the Visual Diff window, select File > Print Setup from the menu bar. The Print Setup dialog opens.

  2. Enter any or all of the following information, as required:

    • Select a printer from the Printer drop-down list box. If your printer is not in the list, click Network and select a printer using the Connect to Printer dialog.

    • Select a paper size from the Form drop-down list box.

    • Select a paper orientation by clicking the Portrait or Landscape option button.

    • Select the appropriate option button for two-sided printing.

  3. Click More to see additional options. You can set resolution, scaling, etc. with the Advanced Document Properties dialog.

  4. Click OK when all specifications have been entered.
